intro: Hesperis quadrangula, commonly known as the four-cornered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant is characterized by its four-angled stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Hesperis quadrangula is often found in dry habitats such as scrublands and coastal areas.
